result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10/13/22:  Court reduced cash bond from $6,000.00 to $4,000.00.  No monies have been posted yet.  Defendant still needs to post $4,000.00.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 15 days of release.

9:33 AM Defendant Deshaun K Reliford in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Deshaun K Reliford.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Court grants motion to modify bond.
Court orders cash bond reduced to $4,000.00.
Hearing set for 12/1/22 to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.

Motion for Bond Modification

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
